intro: Wahlbergella angustiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved orchid, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and delicate, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
